name: Geodis
overview:
Geodis SA provides transportation and logistics services principally in France, Europe, southeast Asia, Africa, and Latin America. It operates through four divisions: Logistics, Distribution, Full Truck Load, and International Freight Forwarding. The Logistics division engages in the design, implementation, and management of production and distribution logistics in France and internationally. The Distribution division operates a European Groupage network for various shipments and for the distribution in just-in-time. The Full Truck Loads division engages in the management of procurement and distribution of physical flows in France and Europe. The International Freight Forwarding division offers air, rail, sea, and roads logistic services, as well as other import and export services for international trade. The company also provides logistics for returns, as well as involves in recycling of end-of-life products and refurbishing of reusable products. It serves various sectors, such as multimedia, industrial, automotive, healthcare, chain distribution, fast moving consumer goods, aeronautics and defense, petroleum, home and leisure, print media, and textiles.

The company, formerly known as Compagnie Generale Calberson, was founded in 1904 and is headquartered in Clichy, France. As of July 1, 2008, Geodis SA operates as a subsidiary of SNCF Participations.
